UpperArmsBBPreacherCurl.name: Barbell Preacher Curl
UpperArmsBBPreacherCurl.preparation: Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad. Grasp curl bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
UpperArmsBBPreacherCurl.execution: Raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower barbell until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
UpperArmsBBPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of biceps brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of biceps brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract.

UpperArmsBBStandingPreacherCurl.name: Barbell Standing Preacher Curl
UpperArmsBBStandingPreacherCurl.preparation: Placing back of arms on pad with one foot forward, grasp curl bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
UpperArmsBBStandingPreacherCurl.execution: Raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower barbell until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
UpperArmsBBStandingPreacherCurl.comments: Body should be positioned to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of biceps brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of biceps brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract.

UpperArmsBBProneInclineCurl.name: Barbell Prone Incline Curl
UpperArmsBBProneInclineCurl.preparation: Lie prone on incline bench with shoulders near top of incline. Knees can rest on seat or legs can be straddled to sides. From low rack or partner, grasp curl bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
UpperArmsBBProneInclineCurl.execution: Raise bar until arms are flexed. Lower barbell until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
UpperArmsBBProneInclineCurl.comments: Also known as Barbell Spider Curl. The long head (lateral head) of biceps brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of biceps brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract.
